intro: Ipomopsis longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a velvety texture, while its stems are hairy and branching. Ipomopsis longiflora is valued for its ornamental beauty and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
